stories.text:
Hi HN,

A recruiter from Amazon contacted me recently offering a job. I've been through their interviews a few times now and flunked.

He mentioned the same process as usual - coding screen, then a 5 round virtual onsite with a mix of A algo/sys design and behavioral questions.

To me, the behavioral questions are basically impossible. I can't think of these situations on the fly and try to prep but it never goes very well.

At this point I really just don't want to go through the entire pointless rigmarole again.

I might like to work at a few specific teams on Amazon if they matched my technical interests and skills.

Is it crazy to ask my recruiter to let me interview for team X,Y and Z directly? I'm imagining it more like a real interview at a startup, where I could just speak directly to the hiring manager and team members, present a tailored resume showing my skills at what they need and an interview process focusing on those particular domains.

Is it okay to ask for this? Is there any chance they will approve it?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it crazy to ask for team specific interview at Amazon?
